main.controller

Class MainController

  • java.lang.Object
    • javafx.application.Application
      • main.controller.MainController

  • public class MainController
extends javafx.application.Application
    main controller class, takes care of the initialization of the game, collision detection and keyboard handling

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  MainController.ClickedButton
      enum for possible clicked buttons
      class  MainController.KeyEventHandler
      the key event handler for controlling the player, so far only up, down, left and right are available
      class  MainController.MouseEventHandlerGiveButton 
      class  MainController.MouseEventHandlerInfoButton

      defines the different mouse event handlers for the various buttons

      • checkForCollision

        public boolean checkForCollision()
        Checks for a collision between the player and all items, objects and characters in the game
        Returns:
        Returns true if there was a collision between the player and anything else

      • checkForCollisionWithObject

        public boolean checkForCollisionWithObject(Object object)
        Checks for a collision between the player and an object (like a tree or a house) must be public, or otherwise unit test cannot access it (same for following methods)
        Parameters:
        object - The object that might have collided with the player
        Returns:
        Returns true if there was a collision between the player and the object

      • checkForCollisionWithCharacter

        public boolean checkForCollisionWithCharacter(Character character)
        Checks for a collision between the player and a character
        Parameters:
        character - The character that might have collided with the player
        Returns:
        Returns true if there was a collision between the player and the character

      • checkForCollisionWithItem

        public boolean checkForCollisionWithItem(Item item)
        Checks for a collision between the player and an item placed somewhere in the world
        Parameters:
        item - The item that might have collided with the player
        Returns:
        Returns true if there was a collision between the player and the item

      • processMouseEvent

        public void processMouseEvent(java.lang.Object clickedObject)
        the actual game logic, is called (by the views) every time the user clicks on an entity on the UI clickedButton contains the button that was clicked before
        Parameters:
